titleInfo.subTitle: Charles Vincent oral history interview, 2002

name.description: "Charles Vincent was born in Hazlehurst, Miss., on October 19, 1945. He attended Utica Junior College, Jackson State University, and Louisiana State University. He has a Ph.D. in history and teaches at Southern University. Vincent has been a visiting professor at Louisiana State University and eminent scholar at Virginia State University (Petersburg). He is the author of ""Black Legislators in Louisiana Reconstruction"" and ""A Centennial History of Southern and A&M College, 1880-1980."""

mods.abstract: Vincent discusses racism and social turbulence in Baton Rouge and the South in the 1960s and 1970s, including the murder of Emmett Till, his experiences with racism while growing up in Southwest Mississippi, incidents with police on the Southern University campus in the 1960s and 1970s, nonviolence and the violent deaths of African-American leaders, and relationships among the Southern University administration, faculty, and students during the period.
